reviews.text:
Beautiful church, they are slowly completing it on the inside, the art work and icons are breathtaking.

They should upgrade the front door tho, I think it’s about time... :) 

God bless

Place of prayers.Cathedral/ Church.
 Catholic Church. Beautiful. Great priests.Come and see for yourself.  Sunday at 10.00 a.m English mass
Nice church. Went for a baptism. First time inside. I liked it.
Big beautiful church.  But I hope it was without the big Eye painted on the wall  .
This is a very beautiful and large cathedral inside and out.
Previously known as Christ the King - Dietrich Bonhoeffer Lutheran Church

I was there several times as one of the vendors at the Farmers Market and Indoor Market selling the handmade sake chocolates.  Since it’s a historical place and the old railway station is nicely preserved & renovated to become a museum, so this location attracts visitors and gives people the opportunity to understand how our forefathers used to live in this community.  The Indoor Market was held inside the barn in autumn until Christmas.  The barn is small but it’s decorated with stylish design.  Staying inside was warm and comfortable.  Market manager, Kim Kwan, is a nice lady, and so are other vendors.  In the summertime, the market was held in the parking area outside the barn which was not an ideal location for my products as they could melt under sunshine in hot weather.

I got really excited about going to a Historical part of the city of Markham. The market advertised produce and artisans. However, when my husband and kids got there, there were only maybe 6-10 artisans, with jewellery, bread, wine, some deliciously smelling garlic dressing, honey and some other things. No produce though.  The building was really great, it had a historical feel and the proximity to the railway was just great. 
It was just a bit upsetting to not find any produce.
Interesting vendors,specially the Sake chocolate and organic dog treats.Thoroughly enjoyed the cranberry-apple cider recommended by the vendor-the cranberry added a lovely tart flavour
A beautiful place to visit the charming unionville farmer's market.
Very few stalls, though those that ate there are good. Staites honey is my go-to for honey. There used to be many more vendors there and it was more worth your time.
Great looking historical building with a convenient store that isn't overpriced.
Bakery is great at store. Must try!
Great piece of history

The Planing Mill is a redeveloped building of the original which was destroyed in a 1983 fire. The building is stunning in its architectural design and offers a unique nostalgic experience for first time visitors to Main Street.
People come to see, but for selling is not a good place
Very nice area
Great for Summer camps!
一个具有德国风情的古老小镇Unionville（渔人村），位于多伦多万锦市Hwy7/Kennedy的西北角。小镇最早由德国人建于1794年，后来 加拿大著名的几位画家，即“七人组”亦在这里定居。虽然经过了两百多年，主街上的古老建筑仍然保持原貌。临街有乐坛，画廊和几家小旅馆，还有几十家欧式的 餐厅和咖啡店。

This museum is small but very intimate, offering many art programmes to the community including art camps, drawing classes etc.Today I visited the exhibit of artist, Paul Fournier, a living, breathing Canadian artist we Ontarians should all be very proud of.I love the brilliant burst of colors on canvas and the three-dimensionality of the acrylic. I aspire to own one of his pieces.And here's a tidbit of Unionville. Some scenes from the Gilmore Girls were apparently filmed here. If you stroll along Main Street (the gallery is at the top of Main Street), you might think you are in Stars Hollow, but apparently, the scenes involved one of the homes on Main Street that served as the interior of Luke's place behind his diner.Readers please correct me if I am wrong!

This museum is small but very intimate, offering many art programmes to the community including art camps, drawing classes etc. Today I visited the exhibit of artist, Paul Fournier, a living, breathing Canadian artist we Ontarians should all be very proud of. I love the brilliant burst of colors on canvas and the three-dimensionality of the acrylic. I aspire to own one of his pieces. And here's a tidbit of Unionville. Some scenes from the Gilmore Girls were apparently filmed here. If you stroll along Main Street (the gallery is at the top of Main Street), you might think you are in Stars Hollow, but apparently, the scenes involved one of the homes on Main Street that served as the interior of Luke's place behind his diner. Readers please correct me if I am wrong!

Visited to see "Witness", Canadian art of the First World War. An excellent gallery  space in a beautiful area. This exhibit in particular is definitely worth the visit. Amazing works of art and a glimpse into Canadian history.
Free art gallery. Not a lot of pieces but we'll laid out with good interpretation.
Good place, with the staff constantly updating the content of the place. It deserves more attentions.

I’ve lived in so many cities that I must have like 5 library cards in my name but this is my FAVOURITE library to come to! Although there are bigger, newer libraries, this quaint library will forever have my heart. It looks like a quintessential antique home, with a beautiful garden in the back to read in. Within this wonderful compact space, it has everything you’d need, including reading areas, study rooms, a children’s playing area, and a computer lab. The library is small, and therefore doesn’t have the widest selection of books, so I usually have to place books on hold and have them transported over. However it’s so worth it because the librarians here are amazing! I’ve discovered some of my FAVOURITE books from their recommendations, and you can tell they are true book lovers from their wealth of knowledge.

It is a very nice place to visit and study. When entering the western entrance. The right side is a big room with large print and DVDs. The left side will lead you to kids area, fiction, non-fiction area. The study room does not need a reservation. The whole environment is quiet and clean. The staff are very friendly and helpful. The parking along the road side and backyard is good. If you park backyard, be prepared to back out. At least for me, I do not know how to turn around in the small area.

Cold, tiny and not enough plugs at the very few cramped desks available. There’s only one plug in the corner behind the tables and forget about using it if someone is sitting at that seat. Cute building and nicely renovated but it’s not a good place to study. Plus the bathrooms are right where the tables and computers are. The doors to the bathrooms are loud and whatever goes on behind those doors, you hear it all.
Nice place for quiet reading. Limited parking spaces. Nice little garden available. Very quiet place.
most cozy library, reminds me of the good old times!
The waiting time is way too long.

Good is fine if you are looking for a quick bite. The place is clean with moder decor.  The food quality is pretty good but the taste is very ordinary.  I usually order Cantonese Fried noodle and steam rice stuffed with shrimp.  The service is extremely quick and dishes are fair size.

The restaurant offers a lot of choices on their menu and you're sure to find something that will interest you. In general the place is clean and seems somewhat new. However the service barely gets a passing grade. Some of them seemed asleep and some of them just seemed disinterested. The food is not bad and not very good either. So everything was pretty average. Except for the portions which are pretty big. You do get your bang for your buck.

It was a great place for a quick bite and so comfy Chinese food.
We walked in around afternoon time and the prices were very reasonable.
Definitely a go to place when in town.

My wife found this busy Chinese restaurant and she also had to wait for a table. We made reservations and when we arrived there were dozens of people waiting. The menu is vast and takes awhile to read with dozens of exotic dishes including some Thai dishes. The servings were quite large so we had plenty to take home. Try the BBQ duck as it was fabulous. And the mango slush was also delicious.
Quick.  Good service.  Good food. Fair price. Big. Clean.  Been going there forever

Our server was lovely. My steak was very nicely done although greek salad a touch on the vinegary side and hubby's chicken club was good but the mayo he said tasted sweet? The juices (orange & grapefruit) weren't enjoyable though. But in all a very nice meal ☺

Best veggie burger I have had anywhere in Markham /Richmond Hill area! Ordered a few times from here thru Skip the dishes and all our specific inclusions /exclusions were honored and food was delicious every time. Special thanks to the manager / owner Ron for making sure everything was perfect ! Highly recommended for take /out delivery, and looking forward to visiting the restaurant and enjoying their patio in the summer :)

I've always come here for drinks but never for eating, until a couple of weeks ago. I've got to say...why haven't I eaten here before???

I feel like I've been missing out on a place that provides you with home cooked meals away from home. I went with a bunch of close friends for lunch and I ended up ordering the fish tacos with fries and gravy. So let's start with the gravy...probably the most delicious gravy I've ever had the pleasure of dipping my French fries into, I could only imagine what it would have been like to have eaten one of their poutines (which is what one of my buddy's ordered). And my fish tacos were delicious; crunchy crust on the outside and a flaky juicy fish inside, it was wonderful.

I haven't had anything else from here so I cannot really comment on the other dishes. But everyone was happy with what they ordered, there were no complaints. If you are ever in the area and you want more than just drinks, grab a bite to eat from here, you will not regret it!
I was served by a very intelligent waitress (makenzie) who didn't waste any time greating me. The food was amazing and overall I enjoyed my experience :) thank you very much!
Cozy place for drinks. I usually go there for a drinks but occasionally dined there. The steak and burger are always nice.

It was our first time here and my husband had a long black hair in his food, which turned him off completely. The waitress assured us a new plate so we waited and they gave us a meal for free. But having a hair in your food is a turn off. Everything else was good.

Great experience! The family loved it. The kids actually ate the food and played in the play area. My sister and I enjoyed both the ambiance and food. Overall, a wonderful experience. Faisal was on the ball. Keep up the good work Markham location!

A great place for kids as there is a small indoor playground. The food is good if you know what to order, and I loved their lentil soup. Service was very friendly, and nice environment. Not too overpriced, but not so cheap you would go there every week. Maybe when friends for family comes over.
Wonderful and new experience, delicious food. The hummus was excellent. They still have to learn how to set up their customers when they sit to eat, maybe it's a cultural thing.

Great service and very child-friendly. They have a play area, but it's best suited for 4+ I think. The manager (I assume) greeted us and seeing that we had a toddler informed us about the kids eat free special. He put her order in immediately and gave us time to review the menu. Food was hot and delicious when it arrived. I liked the open kitchen so u could see the chefs prepare our meal, it seemed clean and organize and helped entertain my kid while we waited for food. Would definitely come back.
